name: outroar
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a situation in which a lot of people complain about something angrily or make a lot of noise: Imagine the outroar there would be if they wrote a piece supporting him. After a global outroar from the game's fans, it was soon back online. Synonyms
outcry
uproar
More examplesFewer examplesThe reason why the outroar has died down is because most reasonable people have come to understand that the decision is simply good sense.The French President's meeting triggered an outroar from Turkey.
